title: John Muir Country Park Walking Route

images.title: Mike Pennington / Dunes, John Muir Country Park
images.caption: Dunes, John Muir Country Park. A sea of marram grass; North Berwick Law is in the distance.

images.title: Mike Pennington / Beach at John Muir Country Park
images.caption: Beach at John Muir Country Park. A warm early spring day has brought out many visitors, including many surfers. Bass Rock can be seen in the distance

images.title: Mike Pennington / Tyne Estuary, John Muir Country Park
images.caption: Tyne Estuary at the park. Saltmarsh forming in the lee of the dunes; Tyninghame is in the distance.

images.title: Mike Pennington / Tyne Estuary, John Muir Country Park
images.caption: Tyne Estuary. The concrete is the remains of wartime coastal defences.

images.caption: Rhea at the East Links Family Park (geograph 5811074)

images.title: Dune and duneslack grassland at John Muir Country Park by M J Richardson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dune and duneslack grassland at John Muir Country Park

description: Explore this beautiful section of the East Lothian coastline in this country park in Dunbar. The lovely park has great views of Belhaven Bay and includes the John Muir Way long distance trail. You can pick up the trail to extend your walk and head through the countryside to East Linton, with views of the River Tyne on the way. In the park there's lovely beaches and a wide variety of plantlife and birdlife to look out for. Just to the west of the site you can find miles of peaceful walking trails in Binning Wood. It's a good place for bird spotting and you may even see otters in the pond or the burn that runs through the woods. You could also try our circular Dunbar Cliff Walk which passes close to the park and gives fine views of the ruined Dunbar Castle and Bass Rock.
